page.title: 14A comparison of two farms
page.content: Poplar Farm is a fruit farm with a little arable acreage and only has the farmer and his son working on it. It consists of 212 acres, growing strawberries, raspberries, gooseberries, blackcurrants, potatoes, wheat and barley. The barley and wheat are used for cereals. His main equipment is a combine harvester with a couple of tractors and attachments. All servicing and repairs are done on the farm limiting their time out of use. At the end of the summer he starts to breed turkeys for Christmas. They are housed in a large round pen and when big enough are allowed to roam around the whole shed.Battery techniques are used to give a better return on the birds.
